Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2008 09:53PM daisy234 wrote: So glad you were smart enough to get 2nd opinion. However, I think that is much too long to wait! It almost 3 weeks Bug whoever you can..ask why.......demand answers ...it is your right. .Don't know where you are but in CA I believe there is a law on how long a pathologydiagnosis should take . Each state has a set of laws - check it out. Hugs........
Posts.Title: patience..... Beth1128 Dukemom2

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2008 11:16PM daisy234 wrote: I just bristle whenever I read that a woman has to second guess her own diagnosis from a dr. and find a different dr.  OR that she had to wait a month for pathologyresults. This is wrong -no matter who the dr. is. Women need to know that diagnostic results are regulated under official guidelines. There is a Pathologic Association that pathologists must belong to and the guidelines are posted on that site online [sorry but don't have the exact name but it is easily found -- Just  Google Official Guidelines for Diagnostic Pathology. It should state the timeline for reporting results to a patient.  For example in CA - a pabst smear  result MUST be reported to a patient within 10 days or it is in violation of the law.  T hank goodness you had the smarts to check things out on your own.

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2008 12:25AM daisy234 wrote: Dukemon - aarrghh  how awful for you! The DR. is the one who must assure that you get you the results. Leaving it to  a nurse is medically unprofessional.. Even though it was good news -- I would not blame you for expressing your indignity to both of them though!
Posts.Title: My biopsy results should be in by now nerveousnellie daisy234

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2008 01:40AM daisy234 wrote: I know you must be scared but don't wait- It could be an infection of some kind BUT  don't be taking antibiotics for something not diagnosed     If you are low income-you might call Every Woman Counts Org. Find it by Google online  and get the #  Ask if they can get you a mammo or what they suggest or go to your county medical clinic to see if you can get Medi-caid or Medi-Cal OR call the American Cancer Society and see if they can help God Bless
